prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** Before constructing the final shape, a new coordinate system needs to be created. The Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0101, 0.0324, 0.0]. This will be the basis for creating the first part, which is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The first sketch will be drawn on the XY-plane of the newly created coordinate system. This sketch is composed of one face, face_1. Face_1 contains one loop, loop_1. Loop_1 is closed and is made up of 8 line segments. The line segments are described below in sequence: * Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.7297, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.7297, 0.0) and ending at (0.7297, 0.3243) * Line 3: Starting at (0.7297, 0.3243) and ending at (0.4865, 0.3243) * Line 4: Starting at (0.4865, 0.3243) and ending at (0.4865, 0.4865) * Line 5: Starting at (0.4865, 0.4865) and ending at (0.2432, 0.4865) * Line 6: Starting at (0.2432, 0.4865) and ending at (0.2432, 0.3243) * Line 7: Starting at (0.2432, 0.3243) and ending at (0.0, 0.3243) * Line 8: Starting at (0.0, 0.3243) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) Once the sketch is complete, Scale it with a scaling parameter of 0.7297. Then, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system property. Now, the final step for generating this part is to Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards normal is 0.0061, while the extrusion depth opposite normal is also 0.0061. The sketch_scale is the previously mentioned scaling parameter, 0.7297. With this, the first part of the CAD assembly is complete. The shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Its length is 0.7297, its width is 0.0122, and its height is 0.7297.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2:3:4. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5507, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system defined above, and create a rectangle with the following dimensions: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.3928] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.3928] to [0.0, 0.3928] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.3928] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the rotation and translation defined in the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis to the depth of 0.5507 units. Part 2: Cutting a Notch in the Top Prism Create a notch in the top prism by removing a portion of the rectangular prism. The dimensions of the notch are as follows: 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.75, 0.0207, 0.0207] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system defined above, and create a rectangle with the following dimensions: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5287, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.5287, 0.0] to [0.5287, 0.3515] - Line 3: [0.5287, 0.3515] to [0.0, 0.3515] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.3515] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.5287. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the rotation and translation defined in the coordinate system. 5. Subtract the 3D sketch from the previously extruded rectangular prism, by specifying the "CutFeatureOperation" in the "operation" property of the extrusion object. Final shape: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom The final CAD shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. The top prism has a notch with a width equal to 0.6884 units (approximately), and the length and height of the top prism with the notch are also 0.6884 units.</description>
